page.title: 09Bredwardine; Events.
page.content: The highlights of the year are the Village Fete in aid of St. Andrew's Church, the Harvest Supper, Annual Whist Drive, and the Raft Race. The annual Fete is held on the first Saturday in August in the field opposite the Red Lion Inn. There are produce and bottle stalls, pony rides, skittles, hoop-la, games of skill, and a lucky dip. There is also an Auction, and teas are served in the Village Hall. In 1985 the receipts were about Â£650. The annual Raft Race is held on the River Wye. It starts at Hay-on-Wye and finishes at Chepstow, taking three days to complete. Bredwardine Bridge is a popular vantage point and timing post. The Race is organised by the Committee for Herefordshire Amateur Rafters, and the proceeds go to charity.
